page.title: 15RECREATION IN LUGWARDINE
page.content: The Church and the PTA of Lugwardine Village Primary School provide the recreational activity within the village. The community comes together rarely - for the Church Fete on the vicarage lawn in June, and St Mary's R.C. School fete in July. The City of Hereford provides other recreational facilities, including Scouts and Guides. Brownies and Cubs meet in Bartestree. The majority of homes have at least two television sets and video recorders. 90% of houses receive a daily paper - Mail, Telegraph, Express and Times are the most popular. A variety of women's magazines are ordered from the village shop, together with specialist magazines. Shooting and fishing are available locally. Certainly the most popular hobby is gardening.
